description: A judge in New Mexico has dismissed the involuntary manslaughter trial of actor Alec Baldwin. He'd been charged for the 2021 shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of the movie Rust.
title: Judge dismisses actor Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial

description: California rap artist Ronnie Louvier will soon find out if his 2009 murder conviction will be overturned under the Racial Justice Act. He said his rap lyrics shouldn’t have been used in the case.
title: Howard students help a rapper request a new trial after lyrics were used as evidence

description: A new lawsuit filed by record labels Universal, Sony and Warner says their catalogs have been ripped off by two AI music generators. But there’s a twist: It’s not clear the courts are on their side.
title: The music Industry is coming for AI

description: A new law opens up outdoor preschools to low income families in Colorado by allowing them to accept state child care subsidies. Advocates say learning outdoors has advantages over indoor classrooms.
title: Colorado has approved licenses for outdoor preschools, making them more accessible

description: President Biden doubled down on his decision to stay in the presidential race at Thursday's press conference. It was a solid performance, but he made some notable gaffes.
title: What NPR's poll says about the state of Biden's campaign

description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with journalist and writer Rebecca Traister about America's aging political leaders and gerontocracy in the U.S.
title: Why older leaders seem resistant to passing the torch

description: The galaxies' fanciful names belie their actual ages: In this case of the Penguin and the Egg, it’s the Egg that came first.
title: 2 galaxies, the Penguin and the Egg, get a family portrait thanks to Webb Telescope

description: Traders are using publicly available data to track which lawmakers are reporting big stock market gains. We try to copy them.
title: How to invest like Congress

description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Democratic Congressman Scott Peters about being one of the Democratic lawmakers calling for President Biden to bow out of November’s election.
title: Democratic Rep. Scott Peters criticizes Biden for staying in race

description: Georgia and Arizona, two Sunbelt states Donald Trump narrowly lost in 2020, are seen as crucial in 2024. Republicans there seek to turn MAGA enthusiasm into votes through unconventional campaigning.
title: Donald Trump's big get-out-the-vote strategy in Arizona and Georgia? Donald Trump

description: New research says climate change has caused toxic metal pollution to double in some Colorado rivers and mountain streams. It's complicating efforts to clean up abandoned mining sites.
title: Climate change is making Colorado mountain streams more acidic and polluted

description: The United States Justice Department says it has foiled at least four assassination plots sponsored by foreign governments on U.S. soil. One of the targets of those assassination attempts is Masih Alinejad, an Iranian-American journalist and activist who Iran allegedly tried to have killed in New York. We hear how knowing she is at such risk has turned Alinejad's life upside down.
title: When a Foreign Government is Trying to Kill You on U.S. Soil

description: How do you stay cool when it's 120 degrees and there's no AC? Dr. Gulrez Shah Azhar, who grew up in India, shares strategies from the Global South.
title: How to stay cool in extreme heat without air-conditioning

description: Many residents are ignoring the order as Israel renews military action in Gaza's largest city. A local civil defense group said the neighborhood of Shujaiya is uninhabitable.
title: Israel again orders thousands of people in Gaza City to evacuate

description: AT&T believes the data, which was stolen in April, is no longer publicly available. Affected current and former customers will be notified by the company but can also check their status online.
title: AT&T says call and text data was stolen from 'nearly all' cell customers in 2022

description: A new NPR poll shows where things stand after Biden's bad debate. Many Palestinian residents in Gaza were just returning to find their homes gone.
title: Why poor debate may not have hurt Biden. And, Israel orders another Gaza City evacuation

description: The funeral for a doctor who was killed in a Russian missile strike on a children's hospital in Kyiv accentuates the wartime danger and losses for Ukraine's medical community.
title: Strike on children’s hospital marks another Ukrainian facility hit by Russian attack

description: President Biden says he's staying in the race. But if fellow Democrats should persuade him to leave, what is the realistic timeline to stand-up a new campaign?
title: If Biden dropped out, how long would it take a candidate to set up a viable campaign?

description: In this week's StoryCorps, Michael Rogers came to the StoryCorps booth to talk about how his work as a death doula changed his perspective on life.
title: A former inmate finds meaning through his work as a death doula

description: Tweens are now major consumers of skin care products, fueled by social media. But dermatologists are seeing kids with rashes caused by products not meant for young skin. What should tweens be using?
title: Social media is fueling a tween skin care craze. Some dermatologists are wary

description: The poll also found that, at this point, no other mainstream Democrat who has been mentioned as a replacement for the president on the ticket does better than President Biden.
title: After Biden's debate performance, the presidential race is unchanged

description: Heat records have been crumbling this summer in the U.S., creating dangerous conditions for those exerting themselves outside. When the body gets overheated, it struggles to perform basic functions.
title: Hiking during extreme heat can be deadly. Here's why and how to stay safe

description: Plastic Free July is upon us! Rebecca Prince-Ruiz, founder of Plastic Free July, encourages people to take the challenge with friends, start small and keep a “plastic free kit” on hand.
title: How to live without plastics for a month, according to the founder of a global movement

description: In other news, Nikki Haley did a thing, Trump says he doesn't know a thing, and the Republican platform ignored a thing.
title: What celebrity loves Biden — but wants him to drop out? Find out in the quiz

description: In 2016, Wisconsin Republicans tried to stop Donald Trump’s march to the presidential nomination. In 2024, his relationship to Republicans in the state hosting the GOP convention is complicated.
title: Trump has a lock on the GOP, but his relationship to Wisconsin Republicans is complex

description: NPR'S Sacha Pfeiffer speaks with Democratic Sen. Ron Wyden of Oregon, chair of the Senate Finance Committee, about Democrats' call for an investigation of Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas.
title: Wyden is 1 of 2 Democratic senators who want DOJ to investigate Justice Thomas

description: President Biden's news conference monitored for mistakes. After Biden-Trump debate, poll on presidential race is out. Palestinians who fled parts of Gaza City return to find little left of their homes.
title: Morning news brief

description: Florida and a handful of other states declined to apply for millions of federal dollars for projects to draw down carbon emissions. Now it falls to cities to make their own climate plans.
title: Why climate action in Florida doesn't look like other states

description: Former President Donald Trump is expected to announce his running mate before the Republican National Convention begins Monday. It's a decision that could help shape the party's direction for years.
title: Trump is expected to announce his VP pick before the GOP convention convenes

description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Austan Goolsbee, president of the Federal Reserve Bank in Chicago, about what the latest inflation data could mean for whether interest rates are lowered in the near future.
title: Labor Department report shows inflation easing a bit more than expected

description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Jon Wertheim of Sports Illustrated about men's semifinals day at Wimbledon.
title: Men's semifinal matches will occupy center court at Wimbledon

description: Who gets to compete? Since the beginning of women's sports, there has been a struggle over who qualifies for the women's category. Tested follows the unfolding story of elite female runners who have been told they can no longer race as women, because of their biology. As the Olympics approach, they face hard choices: take drugs to lower their natural testosterone levels, give up their sport entirely, or fight. To understand how we got here, we trace the surprising, 100-year history of sex testing. Tested is a new 6-part series from NPR's Embedded and CBC. Hosted by journalist Rose Eveleth, it launches July 15, ahead of the 2024 Olympic Games. Embedded+ supporters enjoy early and ad-free access.
title: Introducing Tested from NPR and CBC

description: Prosecutors say the Democrat accepted nearly $150,000 in gold bars and hundreds of thousands of dollars in cash to corruptly abuse his power. Menendez has pleaded not guilty to charges
title: Jury to begin deliberations Friday in bribery trial of New Jersey Sen. Bob Menendez

description: A lawsuit was filed against Hershey, Walgreens and several others in the case of a teen who died after he participated in a spicy tortilla chip challenge that was widely promoted on social media.
title: Family files lawsuit in case of teen who died after eating spicy chip

description: Generative artificial intelligence is becoming more mainstream in China, with companies using it for an unconventional service - to "resurrect" the dead. Many questions are being raised.
title: Chinese companies offer to 'resurrect' dead loved ones. It raises questions
